main.name: Michelle Austin
main.bio: I've been working in the software industry since 2012 as a Technical Project Manager and Business Analyst. In 2018 I learned to code and fell in love with Data Science and Machine Learning. Professionally, my interests lie in Deep Learning and Computer Vision. When I'm not learning more about computers, I do yoga and work on digital art projects.
main.contactmessage: I'd love to hear from you!

resume.skillmessage: Always learning! Check out my progress so far:

work.title: Technical Project Manager
work.description: Wearer of many hats, notably: program management for Cisco Global Events software migration, solution architecture, team lead/mentor

work.title: Senior Project Manager
work.description: Managing software build, implementation, and onsite execution of corporate events for large corporate conferences.

work.title: Business Analyst
work.description: Working with clients and internal devleopment teams to configure and build custom software solutions for large corporate conferences (1.5k-30k attendees).

projects.title: Canadian Wanderlust
projects.category: My Travel Blog for my post-university travels

projects.title: Fury Fighting Gear
projects.category: (offline now) A fighting gear company I started

projects.title: Original Thai Food
projects.category: Website I built for a restaurant I like in Thailand

projects.title: Resume Website
projects.category: A React based resume website template

projects.title: Smirkspace
projects.category: (MVP Only) A React and Meteor based chat University project.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
